Value.label: Swing
Value.Help: Swing is the difference between target temperature and actual room temperature before the heat or cool will turn on. It allows you to control how often your heat will turn on depending on the amount of temperature fluctuation you want to allow. The higher the swing value, the longer it will take for the system to turn on and the wider the range of actual temperature will be. For example: with a cooling setpoint of 72°F and a swing value of 1°F, the air conditioning to turn on at 73°F and off at 71°F.

Value.label: Differential
Value.Help: Differential is the difference between actual room temperature and target room temperature where second stage heating will turn on in a furnace with multiple stages.

Value.label: Set Filter Counter
Value.Help: Set filter replacement timer from 500 to 4000 hours.

Value.label: Report Filter Counter
Value.Help: Read data on replacement timer from 500 to 4000 hours.

Value.label: Temperature Scale Selection
Value.Help: Select which temperature scale you want to use: Fahrenheit (default) or Celsius

Value.label: Setpoint Upper Limit
Value.Help: Setpoint Upper Limit = A Setpoint Lower Limit = B If temperature scale has been set to Celsius, acceptable values for A range from: (B+2) (°C) to 37 (°C) If temperature scale has been set to Fahrenheit, acceptable values for A range from: (B+4) (°F) to 99 (°F)

Value.label: Setpoint Lower Limit
Value.Help: If temperature scale has been set to Celsius, acceptable values range from 5 (°C) to 35 (°C) If temperature scale has been set to Fahrenheit, acceptable values range from 41 (°F) to 95 (°F)

Value.label: Easy Mode
Value.Help: Enabling Easy Mode causes some of the local themostat functions to become inactive: Scheduling, Program Mode, Clock Display, Setting Time, Setting Swing, Setting Differential Set-Point and Advanced Recovery Mode. In Easy Mode, control of these functions is controlled by the z-wave gateway. Regardless of Easy Mode setting, the Change Mode, Change Fan Mode and Temperature Setpoints functionality remain locally controllable via the physical buttons on the thermostat.

Value.label: Time Formatting
Value.Help: Select whether you want to display time on the thermostat screen using 24 hour notation (HH:MM) or 12 hour notation (hh:MM meridian). The default is 12 hour notation.

Value.label: Repeat Basic Set Counter
Value.Help: Thermostat sends "Basic Set" command to its association node repeatedly ever X minutes. 0 = Disabled or Set to Enabled Values available 3 to 255.

Value.label: Auto Reporting Trigger
Value.Help: Automatic reporting is triggered if a new temperature reading is different from previous value by the amount selected here.

Value.label: Timed Auto Reporting Interval
Value.Help: Controls how often the thermostat will auto report current room temperature

Value.label: Temperature Sensor Calibration
Value.Help: Sensor temperature calibration. (This parameter is used to change the display temperature to match with your previous thermostat, or to match another thermostat already installed. Formula: Display Temperature = Sensor Reading Values + Offset Value

Group.label: Heat Pump
Group.Help: A total of 4 associations is allowed for Group 1 and Group 2 combined. Do not associate heat pump and compressor devices in the same association group because heat pump and compressor devices cannot run simultaneously.

Group.label: Compressor
Group.Help: A total of 4 associations is allowed for Group 1 and Group 2 combined. Do not associate heat pump and compressor devices in the same association group because heat pump and compressor devices cannot run simultaneously.
